trans-unit.source: convert_time_unit/3 accepts an additional time unit (other than the ones in the time_unit/0 type) called :native. :native is the time unit used by the Erlang runtime system. It's determined when the runtime starts and stays the same until the runtime is stopped, but could differ the next time the runtime is started on the same machine. For this reason, you should use this function to convert :native time units to a predictable unit before you display them to humans.
trans-unit.target: convert_time_unit/3 는 :native 라는추가 시간 단위 ( time_unit/0 유형의시간 단위 이외)를 허용합니다. :native 는 Erlang 런타임 시스템에서 사용하는 시간 단위입니다. 런타임이 시작되고 런타임이 중지 될 때까지 동일하게 유지되는시기가 결정되지만 다음에 동일한 시스템에서 런타임이 시작될 때 다를 수 있습니다. 따라서사람에게 표시하기 전에이기능을 사용하여 :native 시간 단위를 예측 가능한 단위로 변환해야합니다.

trans-unit.source: on_exit/2 callbacks are executed in a separate process

on_exit/2 callbacks are registered on demand, usually to undo an action performed by a setup callback. on_exit/2 may also take a reference, allowing the callback to be overridden in the future. A registered on_exit/2 callback will always run, while failures in setup and setup_all will stop all remaining setup callbacks from executing.
trans-unit.target: on_exit/2 콜백은 일반적으로 설정 콜백에 의해 수행 된 작업을 취소하기 위해 요청시 등록됩니다. on_exit/2 는 참조를 가져와 향후 콜백을 무시할 수 있습니다. 등록 된 on_exit/2 콜백은 항상 실행되는 반면 setup 및 setup_all 의 실패는나머지 모든 설정 콜백의 실행을 중지합니다.

trans-unit.source: on_exit/2 gets executed in a blocking fashion after a test exits and before running the next test. This means that no other test from the same test case will be running while the on_exit/2 callback for a previous test is running.
trans-unit.target: on_exit/2 gets executed in a blocking fashion after a test exits and before running the next test. This means that no other test from the same test case will be running while the on_exit/2 callback for a previous test is running.

trans-unit.source: on_exit/2 is executed in a different process than the test process.
trans-unit.target: on_exit/2 is executed in a different process than the test process.

trans-unit.source: on_exit/2 is usually called from setup and setup_all callbacks, often to undo the action performed during the setup. However, on_exit/2 may also be called dynamically, where a reference can be used to guarantee the callback will be invoked only once.
trans-unit.target: on_exit/2 는 일반적으로 setup 및 setup_all 콜백에서 호출되며, 종종 설정 중에 수행 된 작업을 취소합니다. 그러나 on_exit/2 는 동적으로 호출 될 수도 있는데, 여기서 콜백이 한 번만 호출되도록 보장하기 위해 참조를 사용할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: Task.yield/2 is an alternative to await/2 where the caller will temporarily block, waiting until the task replies or crashes. If the result does not arrive within the timeout, it can be called again at a later moment. This allows checking for the result of a task multiple times. If a reply does not arrive within the desired time, Task.shutdown/2 can be used to stop the task.
trans-unit.target: Task.yield/2 is an alternative to await/2 where the caller will temporarily block, waiting until the task replies or crashes. If the result does not arrive within the timeout, it can be called again at a later moment. This allows checking for the result of a task multiple times. If a reply does not arrive within the desired time, Task.shutdown/2 can be used to stop the task.

trans-unit.source: Task.yield_many/2 allows developers to spawn multiple tasks and retrieve the results received in a given timeframe. If we combine it with Task.shutdown/2, it allows us to gather those results and cancel the tasks that have not replied in time.
trans-unit.target: Task.yield_many/2 allows developers to spawn multiple tasks and retrieve the results received in a given timeframe. If we combine it with Task.shutdown/2 , it allows us to gather those results and cancel the tasks that have not replied in time.

trans-unit.source: Learn You Some Erlang for Great Good! is an excellent introduction to Erlang, its design principles, standard library, best practices, and much more. Once you have read through the crash course mentioned above, you’ll be able to safely skip the first couple of chapters in the book that mostly deal with the syntax. When you reach The Hitchhiker’s Guide to Concurrency chapter, that’s where the real fun starts.
trans-unit.target: 좋은 일을 위해 당신에게 약간의 Erlang를 배우십시오! Erlang, 디자인 원칙, 표준 라이브러리, 모범 사례 등을 소개합니다. 위에서 언급 한 충돌 과정을 읽은 후에는 대부분 구문을 다루는이 책의 처음 두 장을 건너 뛸 수 있습니다. The Hitchhiker 's Guide to Concurrency 챕터에 도달 하면 진정한 즐거움이 시작됩니다.

trans-unit.source: :sys.get_state/2 - allows retrieval of the state of the process. In the case of a GenServer process, it will be the callback module state, as passed into the callback functions as last argument.
trans-unit.target: :sys.get_state/2 - 프로세스 상태를 검색 할 수 있습니다. GenServer 프로세스의 경우 콜백 함수에 마지막 인수로 전달 된 콜백 모듈 상태가됩니다.

trans-unit.source: :sys.get_status/2 - allows retrieval of the status of the process. This status includes the process dictionary, if the process is running or is suspended, the parent PID, the debugger state, and the state of the behaviour module, which includes the callback module state (as returned by :sys.get_state/2). It's possible to change how this status is represented by defining the optional GenServer.format_status/2 callback.
trans-unit.target: :sys.get_status/2 - allows retrieval of the status of the process. This status includes the process dictionary, if the process is running or is suspended, the parent PID, the debugger state, and the state of the behaviour module, which includes the callback module state (as returned by :sys.get_state/2 ). It's possible to change how this status is represented by defining the optional GenServer.format_status/2 callback.

trans-unit.source: :sys.get_status/2 - allows retrieval of the status of the process. This status includes the process dictionary, if the process is running or is suspended, the parent PID, the debugger state, and the state of the behaviour module, which includes the callback module state (as returned by :sys.get_state/2). It's possible to change how this status is represented by defining the optional GenServer.format_status/2 callback.
trans-unit.target: :sys.get_status/2 - 프로세스 상태를 검색 할 수 있습니다. 이 상태에는 프로세스 사전, 프로세스가 실행 중이거나 일시 중단 된 경우 상위 PID, 디버거 상태 및 콜백 모듈 상태 ( :sys.get_state/2 에 의해 반환 됨)를 포함하는 동작 모듈의 상태가 포함됩니다. 선택적 GenServer.format_status/2 콜백을 정의하여이 상태가 표시되는 방식을 변경할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: :sys.no_debug/2 - turns off all debug handlers for the given process. It is very important to switch off debugging once we're done. Excessive debug handlers or those that should be turned off, but weren't, can seriously damage the performance of the system.
trans-unit.target: :sys.no_debug/2 - 주어진 프로세스에 대한 모든 디버그 처리기를 끕니다. 완료되면 디버깅을 끄는 것이 매우 중요합니다. 지나치게 많은 디버그 처리기 나 해제해야하지만 처리기가 꺼져 있으면 시스템 성능이 심각하게 손상 될 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: :sys.suspend/2 - allows to suspend a process so that it only replies to system messages but no other messages. A suspended process can be reactivated via :sys.resume/2.
trans-unit.target: :sys.suspend/2 - 시스템 메시지에만 응답하고 다른 메시지에는 응답하지 않도록 프로세스를 일시 중단 할 수 있습니다. 일시 중단 된 프로세스는 :sys.resume/2 를 통해 다시 활성화 할 수 있습니다.

trans-unit.source: :sys.trace/3 - prints all the system events to :stdio.
ANSI escape sequences are characters embedded in text used to control formatting, color, and other output options on video text terminals.

trans-unit.source: Domain-specific languages (DSL) allow developers to tailor their application to a particular domain. You don’t need macros in order to have a DSL: every data structure and every function you define in your module is part of your Domain-specific language.
trans-unit.target: DSL (Domain-Specific Language)을 사용하면 개발자가 특정 도메인에 맞게 응용 프로그램을 조정할 수 있습니다. DSL을 사용하기 위해 매크로가 필요하지 않습니다. 모듈에서 정의한 모든 데이터 구조와 모든 기능은 도메인 별 언어의 일부입니다.
